name: stylus-supremacy
description: Make your Stylus files look great again.

stylusSupremacy.insertColons.description: Insert a colon after a property name.

stylusSupremacy.insertSemicolons.description: Insert a semi-colon after a property value, a variable declaration, a variable assignment and a function call.

stylusSupremacy.insertBraces.description: Insert a pair of curly braces between a selector body, a mixin body, a function body and any @block bodies.

stylusSupremacy.insertNewLineBetweenGrou.description: Represent a number of new-line between different type of groups.

stylusSupremacy.insertSpaceBeforeComment.description: Insert a white-space before a comment.

stylusSupremacy.insertSpaceAfterComment.description: Insert a white-space after a comment.

stylusSupremacy.insertSpaceAfterComma.description: Insert a white-space after a comma. Commas appear in serveral places, for example, a function parameter list, a function call, object properties and so on.

stylusSupremacy.insertSpaceInsideParenth.description: Insert a white-space after an open parenthesis and before a close parenthesis.

stylusSupremacy.insertParenthesisAroundI.description: Insert a pair of parentheses between *if*-condition.

stylusSupremacy.insertLeadingZeroBeforeF.description: Insert a zero before a number that between 1 and 0.

stylusSupremacy.quoteChar.description: Represent a quote character that is used to begin and terminate a string. You must choose either single-quote or double-quote.

stylusSupremacy.sortProperties.description:
Can be either 
`false` for doing nothing about the CSS property order, 
"alphabetical" for sorting CSS properties from A to Z, 
"grouped" for sorting CSS properties according to *[Stylint predefined order](https://github.com/SimenB/stylint/blob/master/src/data/ordering.json)*, 
or an array of property names (for example, ["display", "margin", "padding"]).

stylusSupremacy.alwaysUseZeroWithoutUnit.description: Always use *0* without unit in property values.

stylusSupremacy.reduceMarginAndPaddingVa.description: Always use `margin x` over `margin x x x x`, `margin x y` over `margin x y x y` where `x`, `y` is a property value.
